alert.note: Alert for Coconino Plateau; Grand Canyon Country; Kaibab Plateau (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 17 at 2:27PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Coconino County through 300 PM MST... At 226 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Tusayan, or 17 miles west of Desert View at Grand Canyon, moving north at 10 mph towards the south Rim. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph, up to nickel size hail, and frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Maricopa Point At Grand Canyon, Yaqui Point At Grand Canyon, Hermit`s Rest At Grand Canyon, Tusayan, Shoshone Point At Grand Canyon, Grandview Point At Grand Canyon, Pima Point At Grand Canyon, South Rim Visitors Center, Cape Royal At Grand Canyon, Hopi Point At Grand Canyon, Grand Canyon Village and Ten-x Campground. This includes State Route 64 between mile markers 233 and 237. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
